title: Big South Fork National River & Recreation Area: Blue Heron Ghost Train
body: Blue Heron Ghost Train         drawing by Park Ranger Sue Duncan  Ride the Blue Heron Ghost Train to an abandoned coal camp surrounded by the dark hills of Kentucky.   The Ghost Train is September 10, 2016, at 7:00 p.m. Eastern Time.  Enjoy an exciting night time train ride round trip to the Blue Heron Coal Mining Community and Big South Fork National River and Recreation Area. There is a train fare for this activity. Advanced train reservations are recommended. You may contact the Big South Fork Scenic Railway at 800-462-5664 or 606-376-5330 or visit www.bsfsry.com. People wanting to drive their own vehicles may do so by taking Highway 742 from Stearns.  Bring a flashlight and be prepared to walk a short distance. Hear chilling tales from the hills and hollows of the Cumberland Plateau. There is no fee to attend the program at Blue Heron. For additional information call 423-286-7275 or 606-376-3787.
